question:
<katex>$CH_{3}-CH=CH-CH_{2}OH \xrightarrow{PCC} CH_{3}-CH=CH-CHO$</katex>
Hybridisation change involved at C-1 in the above reaction
explanation: Reactant (Alcohol): The C-1 carbon (<katex>$-CH_2OH$</katex>) forms 4 sigma bonds (2 to H, 1 to C, 1 to O). Hybridisation is **<katex>$sp^3$</katex>**.
Product (Aldehyde): The C-1 carbon (<katex>$-CHO$</katex>) forms 3 sigma bonds and 1 pi bond (C=O). Hybridisation is **<katex>$sp^2$</katex>**.
